meanings.definition: A set with an associative binary operation.
meanings.sent1: In math class, we learned about a semigroup, which is a set with a special way of combining elements.
meanings.sent2: The semigroup in algebra class helped us understand how elements can be combined in a specific way.
meanings.sent3: The semigroup at the math party only allowed elements to join if they followed the rules of the special operation.
meanings.sent4: The semigroup of friends worked together seamlessly, like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The concept of a semigroup made the math problem much easier to solve, as it provided a clear structure for combining elements.

meanings.definition: A mathematical structure consisting of a set and an associative binary operation.
meanings.sent1: Studying the semigroup in class helped us understand how a set and operation can work together.
meanings.sent2: The semigroup we studied in math class was a perfect example of how a set and operation can form a structure.
meanings.sent3: The semigroup at the math competition was so organized, it felt like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent4: The semigroup of numbers and symbols danced together in a harmonious mathematical ballet.
meanings.sent5: The concept of a semigroup made the math problem much easier to solve, as it provided a clear structure for combining elements.
